title: Applied Biostatistics Course with R
text:
You can go directly to the Github repository containing all course materials:
https://github.com/bruigtp/curs_bioestadistica_R
There, you can download the materials in a zip compressed folder.



To install the materials locally in your computer you have to follow these instructions:


Install the packages {pak} and {usethis} (first time)
If you don’t have these packages, you have to install them for the first time:

install.packages(c("pak", "usethis"))

To install these packages is necessary to have Rtools installed in your computer.

Install the package {CursBioR} (first time)
If you don’t have the package, you have to install it for the first time:

pak::pak("bruigtp/CursBioR")



Load package and run install_course()
This function will save the materials to an existing path on your computer specified by the destdir argument:

library(CursBioR)

#Download materials to your path:
install_course(destdir = "<YOUR_PATH>")

Remember that R can’t read Windows backslash in paths (\). Thus, we have to manually change all the \ for the / in a path:

Incorrect: C:\Users\username\Documents\CursBioR
Correct: C:/Users/username/Documents/CursBioR







Important



The function downloads the material that has been posted up to that point. For each session, we have to repeat step 3 again to get the new material for the new sessions.

title: Applied Biostatistics Course with R
text: Biostatistics Support and Research UnitGermans Trias i Pujol Research Institute and Hospital (IGTP) Badalona, Spain

title: Applied Biostatistics Course with R
text: Biostatistics Support and Research UnitGermans Trias i Pujol Research Institute and Hospital (IGTP) Badalona, Spain

title: Applied Biostatistics Course with R
text:
This course is an introduction to the use of the open-source software R for clinical data analysis. The course covers the theoretical foundations of descriptive statistics, between-group comparisons, hypothesis testing, linear and logistic regression, and survival analysis. These sessions will be combined with more hands-on sessions where students will see real-world examples using R. Students will also learn how to interpret results obtained with R and how to use these results to make decisions.
In this website you will find how to install all the materials in your computer using R (Install materials) and access all the class slides that are available online (Slides).


 Session 1 (19th March): Introduction to R and Data Management

Session 2 (20th March): Inference and Hypothesis Testing

Session 3 (26th March): Description and between-group comparisons

Session 4 (27th March): ANOVA

Session 5 (2nd April): Introduction to Generalized Linear Models

Session 6 (4th April): Introduction to Survival Analysis
